item.description:
Note: This play has extreme sexual overtones and is for mature audiences only.

For this Meet-up we will return to the 2nd Story Theater in Warren, RI for "The Goat or, Who Is Silvia." Here is their description of the play:

"Edward Albee's shocking, controversioal, and eminently discussable drama presses every button, provoking usually open-minded audiences to question their own moral attitudes and levels of tolerance.  This chronically provocative play is for only the most stalwart of theatergoers.  Pearl clutchers beware."

Wikipedia provides a bit more detail and it sounds like Ed's caution is warranted:

"The tale of a married, middle-aged architect whose life crumbles when he falls in love with a goat, the play focuses on the limits of an ostensibly liberal society. Through showing this family in crisis, Albee challenges audience members to question their own morality in the face of other social taboos including infidelity, homosexuality, pedophilia, incest and, of course, bestiality.

The play also features many language games and grammatical arguments in the middle of catastrophes and existential disputes between the characters."

Ticket Information

Tickets are $25. Seating is General Admission.
Each person is responsible for purchasing their own ticket. For reservations, please call the 2nd Story Theater at 401-247-4200.

Please Note that Friday nights at 2nd Story do sell out early. Please do not wait to order your tickets! I strongly recommend that you order your tickets now.

When you order your ticket, please tell them you are a member of this group.  They will then reserve our seats together.

Meet-up Logistics

There is a fairly large parking lot located next to the theater between Market Street and Route 114 in Warren. A sign for Second Story Theater is on Route 114, although it's somewhat hidden. Identify yourself as a member of this group when you arrive at the theater and they will show you to our seats.
